rows.THE TRADE: Instead of entrepreneurs starting companies from scratch, they receive a complete
operational package at inception: contracts with core vendors, operations manuals,
business opportunity analysis, website completed, brand assets, verification protocols,
hiring playbooks. Everything you'd normally accumulate over years, delivered as a
comprehensive 'textbook' that makes launching feel like purchasing a franchise
The Trade is NOT the spreadsheet. The Trade is NOT the documents.
The Trade is the complete system — the multi-layered machine that connects:
Studio → Labor Chain → Entrepreneur → Running Business
IonWave is one instantiation of the Trade. The Trade is the repeatable machine.
Every future brand gets the same franchise-grade package. The package improves
with each instantiation because the system learns (EV3).
Each layer connects to the next. The Trade is the full stack, not any single layer.

rows.col_2: The origination engine. Designs the Trade, builds the ODD, engineers every role, sets initial conditions.
rows.col_4: Complete franchise-grade packages: ODD, contracts, playbooks, hiring systems, brand assets, governance
rows.col_5: Market intelligence, thesis validation, feedback from running businesses

rows.col_2: The delegation depth system. Multi-layer hiring sequence that staffs the business without founder bottleneck.
rows.col_4: A hired, onboarded, equipped Operator ready to execute
rows.col_5: Role-engineered JDs, assessment rubrics, hiring kits, scoring thresholds, email templates

rows.col_2: The entrepreneur-in-a-box. Receives the complete Trade package and executes it.
rows.col_4: A running business: revenue, customers, brand, supply chain
rows.col_5: The franchise package: 634-tab ODD, contracts, vendor intros, website, creative, onboarding

rows.col_2: The ongoing governance layer. Monitors the Operator, enforces standards, grades performance.
rows.col_4: Grades, escalation triggers, performance reports, risk alerts
rows.col_5: Daily metrics, milestone reports, operating agreement compliance data

rows.col_2: The compounding layer. Every Trade improves the next Trade. Post-mortems, pattern recognition, template updates.
rows.col_4: Updated templates, new Content Types, refined rubrics, better hiring criteria
rows.col_5: Post-mortems, failure analysis, what worked/didn't across all Trades

This is what makes launching feel like purchasing a franchise rather than building from zero.

rows.THE TRADE: TOTAL TIME COMPRESSED: ~12-18 months → ~4-6 weeks to operational
THE CONNECTION MAP — HOW LAYERS LINK
│ encodes judgment into → VA Hiring Kit
VA executes hiring process for CoS
│ uses → CoS JD, Screening Checklist, Email Templates, Pipeline Tracker
CHIEF OF STAFF manages labor chain
│ uses → Recruiter JD, Assessment Workbook, Project Plan
RECRUITER sources and screens Operator candidates
│ uses → Operator JD, Evaluation Matrix, Scoring Thresholds
OPERATOR receives the complete franchise package
│ receives → 634-tab ODD, contracts, vendor intros, website, creative, onboarding
RUNNING BUSINESS produces revenue, data, learnings
│ monitored by → Compliance Manager (daily), CoS (weekly), Studio (monthly)
│ feeds back into → Studio (post-mortems, pattern recognition, template updates)
NEXT TRADE gets an even better package
This is the flywheel. Each Trade makes the next Trade better.
Trade #1 (IonWave) is the hardest. Trade #10 is a machine.

rows.col_2: System is built. Franchise package 80% complete. One hire triggers the full chain.

rows.col_4: 634-tab ops model. Every process, metric, escalation, playbook.
All 7 dimensions × 5 roles. Full D0-D4 delegation depth.
All proprietary concepts defined. Essay published. Games mapped.
Operator, Recruiter, CoS terms. Equity, vesting, milestones, IP, termination.
Decision authority, escalation, compliance, breaking points.
VA Kit (8 tabs), CoS Assessment (6 tabs), Recruiter + Operator JDs/rubrics/onboarding.
Templates for every touchpoint: advancing, rejecting, scheduling, references, reminders.
Unit economics, milestone projections, scenario analysis.
Formulation defined, manufacturer ID'd, packaging concepts.
Shopify spec'd, pages planned, Klaviyo outlined.
Meta strategy, budget allocation, creative brief, UGC strategy.
CM role specified, escalation triggers, grading framework.

rows.col_5: High — customize template, adjust for category

rows.col_3: Pattern library growing. Recruiter relationships established. CoS experienced with process.

The machine. Templates handle 90%+ of variation. Partners source deals. Operators plug in.

rows.THE TRADE: WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM A FRANCHISE
FRANCHISE: You buy a proven brand + proven system. Limited upside. Royalty forever. No equity.
TRADE: You receive a proven system + NEW brand. Full equity upside. Studio takes carry, not royalties.
FRANCHISE: Operator follows rigid playbook. No room for creativity.
TRADE: Operator has decision authority within bounds. Entrepreneurship with guardrails.
TRADE: One SYSTEM applied to different brands, categories, opportunities.
FRANCHISE: Franchisor profits from fees regardless of franchisee success.
TRADE: Studio profits from equity — only wins when the entrepreneur wins.
TRADE: ODD is the entrepreneur's operating manual. Knowledge IS the package.
The Trade takes the best of franchising (proven system, reduced risk, faster launch)
without the worst (no upside, rigid control, misaligned incentives).
It's what you get when you apply initial conditions engineering to entrepreneurship itself.
